name: Levy
info: A Sinner adept at defending. Can block 2 enemies at the same time and increase Max HP by 10%.
maniaIntensifyText: When [Contract Request] hits an enemy, for each [Life Loss] state carried by the enemy, Levy recovers 1% of his Max HP.
criminalRecord:
Levy is the owner of several small businesses in Eastside; he likes to present himself as a fop. Levy is suspected of involvement in dozens of cases of business fraud or unfair competition, indirectly causing the death of a dozen people, who have committed suicide after going bankrupt, seeing their families fall apart, or some other tragedy.

--

As a famous rich heir in Eastside, the subject still keeps his high-profile, absurd style after his arrest. He often describes the Sinners in the Bureau as //boring// during his consultation with the psychologist. Although his nature is impossible to change and he still occasionally harasses staff and advertises products without permission, the MBCC's strictly supervised environment has made it difficult for him to continue his business fraud activity in the Bureau.
mutationAssessment:
+++* Ability Summary
The subject can form a mutual contract with any living being. Once the contract is established, the subject can drain the life and energy from the other party. The subject calls that //reasonable exploitation within the bounds of the contract//.

+++* Awakening Signs
According to Levy himself, he awakened his power and became a Sinner four years ago, when he experienced "indescribable joy and satisfaction" upon revenging himself by every possible means on his relatives who "had abandoned him".

+++* Corruption State
Levy suffers from a low level of Maniac corruption, but no abnormalities have been found on his body. Psychologically speaking, Levy has been found to be a man of low moral standards who is almost entirely devoid of any sense of guilt and has antisocial tendencies.
ecbFlavourText:
"Your factory and land are mine now. In return, your little secret will never be exposed again."
"A pretty fair trade, no?"
interrogation1:
At a company board meeting, Levy ridiculed his cousin and demands a payment of millions of DisCoins. Chad, his cousinâ€™s son and Levyâ€™s nephew, attempts to stick up for his father, and Levy mockingly goads him further, causing Chad to hit him. Levyâ€™s arm is broken and he and Chad are both arrested in the ensuing fight. When it is discovered that Levy is a Sinner, he is transferred to the MBCC. The Chief questions Levy about how a normal teenage boy was able to break the arm of an Endura Sinner, but Levy denies that happened and claims that he broke his arm by falling on it himself. He is dismissive of the issueâ€™s seriousness until the Chief reveals that Chad was found to be carrying a gun when he was arrested, and that he easily could have shot Levy instead if he had been further provoked. This information shocks Levy, and he insists that he be allowed to speak with his nephew so he can help keep Chad from going down the wrong path; he believes that Chadâ€™s father put him up to shooting him because of their financial feud. The Chief is skeptical of Levyâ€™s motives, suspecting that he might be looking for revenge against his nephew, but agrees to allow a meeting.

Levy claims that the culprit of the incident is his cousin and insists on visitng his nephew Chad, his assailant, in the jail in Eastside.
interrogation2:
In an Eastside detention center, Levy and the Chief meet Neil, one of Levyâ€™s former friends. Although he was also the son of billionaires, he lost everything when his parentsâ€™ company went bankrupt and is now working as a simple prison guard. Levy still treats him as a friend, but the Chief can see that Neil hates and resents him, and they correctly surmise that Levy was partially responsible for their bankruptcy. They meet with Chad, who confirms Levyâ€™s suspicions that Chad was put up to the attack by his father. To the Chiefâ€™s surprise, Levy treats his nephew kindly and gently, acting the role of a supportive uncle. They come to a settlement and resolve the brawling case, and Chad is released to be brought home by Levy.

You've managed to get Chad out despite the mild obstacles. Levy heaves like a genuinely caring uncle with his nephew throughout. This surprises you.
interrogation3:
The three return to Chadâ€™s home in a wealthy neighborhood of Eastside. But when they arrive, they find that the house has burned to the ground. While Chad and the Chief are in shock, Levy suddenly turns on his nephew, explaining that Chadâ€™s father had fled the city a few days prior to avoid punishment for having embezzled millions from Levyâ€™s company. Levy had their home burned so that he would be able to sell the property and recoup some of his stolen losses. He mocks the boyâ€™s pain at realizing both his father and his uncle are scum. While the Chief tries vainly to comfort Chad, Levy walks away, laughing. The Chief catches up with Levy and confronts him about his motivation for ruining Chad. Levy explains that he needed to make an example of the boy to prevent anybody else from thinking they could exploit him, but that above all else, he thought it was fun to see how much he could take away from Chad in just a few days. The Chief refutes this though, pointing out how Levy has repeatedly claimed that Chad is just like a younger version of him. They believe that Levy is trying to teach Chad a difficult lesson about what Levy believes is the only way to survive: trust nobody, do everything you want and everything for yourself. Levy agrees to face the consequences of his crimes, and the Chief likens their role to being the uncle who now has to teach Levy a harsh lesson.

Levy has deceived you. Everything was just his //fun plan//. But you expose his disguise. Levy isn't really indifferent to anything like he pretends to be. A true nihilist won't meddle with things like this. Perhaps he just needs a little bit of care and love. These are the things he never received from his //family// in the past.
arrestRec1: Levy crosses paths with the MBCC for the first time during Special Operation [Data deleted], and his identity as a Sinner is exposed in the operation. Two days after the operation, he is arrested by the MBCC's field workers without resistance.
arrestRec2: Levy was born into a wealthy family in Eastside. According to those who knew the family, Levy's parents were cold toward each other, and he didn't grow up in a loving household. From age 10 to age 16, Levy goofed around with some of his unemployed relatives, living an extravagant, preposterous lifestyle. And his parents simply turned a blind eye.
arrestRec3: In N.F. 104, Levy's parents were killed in a car accident. Since Levy was too young to take care of his parents' assets, a so-called //committee of the bereaved// comprised exclusively of Levy's relatives was established to take charge of these assets, which were then divided up among the members of the committee. When Levy came of age, he received less than 8% of what he was entitled to.
arrestRec4: In N.F. 106, the cracks in the relationships between Levy's relatives began to show. The rifts among the board members were deepening, often leading to bloodshed. By N.F. 110, all the members of the //committee of the bereaved// had fallen out of the public eyeâ€”some had committed suicide, some had been murdered, and some had gone bankrupt. Levy now possesses 69.1% of the company's shares, taking back control over his parents' assets.
servingTerm1: As a rule, Levy doesn't turn down the jobs the MBCC asks him to do. But most of the time, he outsources them. Since there's no guarantee that the people Levy outsources the jobs to will complete them satisfactorily, how fast they will be finished, how well, and how completely fluctuate greatly.
servingTerm2: Levy harries the MBCC staffers every now and then. According to some of the victims, Levy "strikes up a conversation in an awkward manner," and the conversation always ends in him trying to sell the garbage his companies are making. But strangely, he steers clear of the Sinners whenever possible. "Too many lunatics among them. It's too risky. Doesn't worth it," Levy once allegedly explained.
servingTerm3: Levy is fun-loving. He proposes on more than one occasion that he fund the establishment of some recreation center within the MBCC, like a bar with music, a room for playing bridge, an amusement arcade, a zoo, and a flea market. All his proposals are vetoed in the end.
servingTerm4: Levy has the habit of launching into farcical hours-long nonsense while sweet-talking his interlocutor into buying his products or signing a business contract full of loopholes. But he takes a completely different attitude when it comes to the Chief; in their conversations, Levy sometimes makes risky remarks.

supervision4:
++* âš âš  About Sunglasses

//You think Levy looks a little weird today.//

**System Notifications:** You think Levy looks a little weird today, so you stare at him for a few extra seconds. He seems to have noticed the gaze from behind and turns back to ask you.

**Levy:** Why do you keep staring at me?

**Chief:** You seem a little different today.

**Levy:** Oh? Do I look even more handsome than yesterday?

**System Notifications:** He pulls down his sunglasses and winks at you. You finally notice what's weird.

* **Prompt:** Something's wrong with the sunglasses.

**Chief:** Don't you have seven pairs of sunglasses of different colors that you switch every day?

**Chief:** Today's Wednesday. Normally, you'd wear the dark green pair. Why the blue one?

**Levy:** Oh my, you remember everything. I didn't know you were paying so much attention to me?

**Chief:** You dance in front of me like a peacock spreading its feathers every day. It's hard not to notice it.

**Levy:** Ahahaha, you like to exaggerate things...

**Levy:** As for which pair is for which day, I didn't want you to get bored, so I changed up the schedule.

**Levy:** Wanna guess what color it is for tomorrow?

**Chief:** ...No. I've got other things to do.
supervision5:
++* âš âš  Fitness Lover

//Levy is lifting a barbell in the Training Room.//

**System Notifications:** You see Levy lifting a barbell when you pass by the Training Room.

**Levy:** 51, 52, 53...

* **Prompt:** Greet

**Levy:** Yo, good timing. I've still got 25 more to go. Help me count.

**Chief:** For someone who has all the excuses in the world to shirk training, you do seem very enthusiastic about hitting the gym?

**Levy:** That's because I've noticed that since coming here, my pecs have been shrinking.

**Levy:** I must keep my perfect body. Without this living billboard, how am I gonna sell those automatic all-in-one foolproof gym machines piled up in my warehouses?

**Chief:** ...

* **Prompt:** Politely decline

**Levy:** I knew you were gonna say that. Perhaps you should get one of my automatic all-in-one foolproof gym machines? It's tailored for busy professionals like you. All you have to do is lie there and gain muscles. It's totally legit...

**Levy:** Hey! Don't go yet! I haven't finished!
supervision6:

baseVoicelines:
[Obtain the Sinner]
What are you doing? I'm a serious businessman. If you keep this up, I'm calling my lawyer! Help! Help! Assault! ...Of course I know lawyers can't come here. You have really have no sense of humor.

[Raise to Phase 1]
There's nothing fun about becoming strong in and of itself, but after becoming strong, you will have more ways to seek out fun.

[Raise to Phase 3]
You give me things all day without taking any of my money... What's in it for you? Could it be that you want //me//? You gotta be careful then, because I will ultimately leave after I've had my fun...

[Level Start]
Hey, want to know what you can buy from me.... with your life?

[Win Battles]
Woohoo! I made a killing this time!

[Lose Battles]
I lost a fortune! I'm not coming back.

[Ultimate Skill]
Everything of yours is mine now!

[Die in Battles]
Fair enough......

[Greeting]
Hey, when can I go out? If I don't find some clients soon, my factory is going to go bankrupt... Alternatively, you can place some orders with me.

[Conversation 1]
You gotta make friends to succeed in business, and to make friends, you gotta have fun with them. Who wouldn't seal a deal with you after having loads of fun together?

[Conversation 2]
When you have money, flies will swarm around you. But flies can also be fun, don't you think?

[Conversation 3]
I have a friend, a painter, who admires my physique and uses me as a canvas. Body art! You understand art? Though it smudges off with one wipe of detergent, I like to keep my friend happy. That way, maybe he'll buy a decade worth of paints from me...

[Special Conversation 1]
I haven't been out for so long. My factory has taken a huge hit as a result. Chief, how will you compensate me?

[Special Conversation 2]
I don't view greed as a sin. To feel satisfied when you get what you want, to feel happy when you see things go your way... Isn't this human nature?

[Special Conversation 3]
Talking about money is the most boring part of business. I prefer something else... like offering a deal that cannot be refused, then watching the other person hand over something they cherish deeply with a look of utmost pain and despair... Now that is addictive.

[Full Compliance]
I've been wondering what your deepest desires is... what must I rob you of to enjoy a look of remorse and despair on your face? But I give up, because you are just like me. There is a bottomless void in your heart... Hahahaha.

[Idle]
I haven't sealed a single deal since coming here?! No... I gotta find Faye tomorrow... She's beautiful inside and out. Surely she will do something about this!

[Annoyed]
200 for one time... Just kidding, I wouldn't dream of sealing such a petty deal with you! If you sign this contract, feel free to touch whenever you want! It's all on me!

[Special Attention]
Are you here to discuss business? Wait a bit, I'm busy watching this livesream. Hehe, this girl ain't bad. Let me send her some gifts...

[Dispatch]
What a coincidence! I happen to have a friend there. Leave it to him!

[Dispatch Complete]
Hello? Oh, it's done? Great! Chief, it's done over there! Everything went according to plan!

[Level Up]
I don't need to pay for this? Are you serious?

guide.title: Summary
guide.text: Levy is a core member of the [Life Loss] composition, also known as the "Bleed team". For more information on this comp, please refer to Yjndae's Bleed guide.

pros: Provides strong amp for [Life Loss] team

crimebrandSets.name: Tuning + Hope + Corridor
crimebrandSets.note: Recommended for BFL since this will get his Ult up the fastest.

crimebrandSets.name: Fleeting Vision
crimebrandSets.note: Recommended in long battles such as ToA as this will help him get Ult up multiple times.

crimebrandSets.name: Nightmare + Hope
crimebrandSets.note: If energy isn't an issue, you can run this support set to buff your team in BFL.

crimebrandSets.name: Justice + Corridor
crimebrandSets.note: Boosts allied Sinners' Attack by 5% after Levy uses Ult. You can run this support set instead of a full energy set in BFL if you don't have energy issues.

crimebrandSets.name: Afterglow + Corridor
crimebrandSets.note: Boosts nearby allied Sinners' Attack by 10% after Levy uses Ult. Although the Attack increase provided is larger than Justice, Afterglow has a 20s cooldown and does not apply mapwide, making it more difficult to use.

shackles.title: Standard Contract
shackles.description: [Fraud Contract]'s energy consumption is reduced by 3.

skills.name: Contract Request
skills.description: Levy throws punches to attack, dealing (Attack*79%) Physical Damage each time.

skills.name: Fraud Contract
skills.description: Levy backs down and drafts a "fair contract", increasing his Magic Resistance by 20% for 12 seconds. While this is active, he cannot automatically recover Energy.

skills.name: Contract Pitfall
skills.description:
When Levy takes damage from an enemy, he inclicts a mark of [Life Loss] on them.
[Life Loss]: Deals (Magic Resistance*25%) Physical Damage per second for 12 seconds.

skills.name: Additional Terms
skills.description: While [Fraud Contract] lasts, all enemies within a 3x3 square around Levy suffer 40% more [Life Loss] damage.

upgrade.description: [Life Loss] Damage Bonus is increased to $0%.
